hanzi-su-wiki:
順

Значения

Порядок, последовательность; следовать, подчиняться; послушание

Мнемоника

Голова 頁 послушного течению реки 川 пловца. Ослушаться указаний учителя — идти против течения.

Варианты

顺
purpleculture_pinyin:
shùn
to obey; to follow; to arrange; to make reasonable; along; favorable
подчиняться; следовать; устроить; сделать разумным; вдоль; благоприятный
rtega_mnemonic:
慎慎RS㥲愼昚眘順慎 𡴜𦚉慎act with care, be cautious, humility
  • heart 忄 investigating carefully to find out the truth 真

順順RS
顺顺		obey, submit to, go along with, order, turn
  • stream 川 of written pages 頁 where commands are ordered which are to be obeyed
  • leaves 頁/页 fallen into the river 川 follow the stream, obey the current, go along with the flow.
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 顺)
Antonyms: 逆
Pictophonetic: 川 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
順利 [ shùn lì ]: smoothly; without a hitch
順應 [ shùn yìng ]: to comply; to conform to; in tune with; adapting to; to adjust to
順手 [ shùn shǒu ]: easily; without trouble; while one is at it; in passing; handy
順序 [ shùn xù ]: sequence; order
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 川 [ chuān ] stream, river
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
heisig_chinese_memo: Obey, Obey!" says the brain-washing scientist as he sends a stream of orders to fill your head.
heisig_constituent: obey, stream, flood, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: In primitive language, this character would read stream . . . head. And that turns out to be convenient for remembering its meaning of obey. Either one obeys the person who is head of an organization or else obeys by following the stream of opinion ("current" practice, we call it). Both these senses come together in this kanji.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: obey, order, turn, right, docility, occasion
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: повинуются, заказ, поворот, вправо, покорность, случай
koohiiStory1: Obey, Obey! says the brain-washing scientist as he sends a stream of orders to fill your head.
koohiiStory2: Obey the orders streaming down from head office.
jp_example_words:
手順(てじゅん): process, procedure, protocol
不順(ふじゅん): irregularity, unseasonableness
順(じゅん): order, turn
順々(じゅんじゅん): in order, in turn
順序(じゅんじょ): order, sequence, procedure
順調(じゅんちょう): favourable, doing well, O.K., all right
順番(じゅんばん): turn (in line), order of things
道順(みちじゅん): itinerary, route
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: For a geoduck to make it into a river, it must know the sequence and order of water flow. Geoducks usually live in the ocean, not in a river, so they must study the order of water flow in order to determine the best sequence for making it into a river.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this geoduck mapping out a plan to get to the river. It’s studying the sequence and order of water flow. See it sitting there, reading a book, reading glasses and all. It’s quite odd.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After extensive study of the sequence and order of water, the geoduck has determined that June (じゅん) is the best time to travel to the river. June is the best time for the temperature and atmospheric pressure to be just right for such a journey. In June, the geoduck will set out.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: June has arrived. Imagine the geoduck making its way from the ocean to the river. Use whatever makes you think of June to link that month to this scene of the geoduck making his way to the river.
Ru_Meaning: obey, order, turn, right, docility, occasion
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 川 (река), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина), 頁 (страница)
Ru_trainchinese:
shùn: (прил) гладкий, без затруднений; гармоничный; складный, хорошо организованный
shùn: (глаг/предлог) двигаться в одном направлении с; следовать; приводить в порядок; поворачивать; подходить (для чего-то); вдоль, по
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the page (頁) will throw you in the river (川) in sequence (unless you obey)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Obey Obey! says the strange piece of paper you pick up floating down the stream.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions are from " Jian ", " Chuan " sound," Jian " is similar to " Page ", and the small seal character evolved from " Page " or from " Jian ". Some words from the sound of " Chuan " have the meaning of obedience. For example, " taming " means the obedience of birds and beasts. Thus " Shun " from " see ", " Chuan " sound, which means people obey appearance. "Shuowen": "Shun, rationale. From the page and from the lame." Xiao Xu was originally written as "the sound of lame." Zhongshan Wangding, Guodian Bamboo Slips and Ancient Seals have the same " heart " and " chuan " sound. Since the " success " of obedience is related to mental activity, it is from the " heart ".

The incomplete oracle bone inscriptions, the meaning of the word " Shun " is unknown, "Tunnan" 2080: "Yu Fu Jia, Qi Shun is better than..."

The inscription " Shun " is used as the original meaning, referring to obedience, as opposed to " reverse ". Zhongshan Wangding: "Keshun Kebei (Bei)", which means to follow the good. "poetry. Daya. "Emperor King": "The king of this great country, conquer Kebi." Mao Heng Chuan: "Compassionate and obedient means obedience, choose good and follow the comparison." "Book of Rites. Music Records, Historical Records. "The Book of Music" is quoted as "Ke Shun Ke Bi". Also Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "Then 𣥺 (top) goes against the sky, and the next is not good for others (also)." " Shun " and " reverse " are opposed. Also, the inscriptions " shun " will be available for the " training " 𣄰 respect: "Shun (training) I do not every (Min)" refers to Xunhui I moronic not smart (Tang Lan, Ma Chengyuan). " Shun " in the handed down ancient slips can also be used as " training ", "The Great Dai Li Ji. "Guardian": "Teacher's Guide." "Jia Zi's New Book. "Bao Fu" " shun " as " training ."

" Shun " in the bamboo slips of the Warring States Period is used as the original meaning, referring to obedience, "Guodian Chujian. "Jian Yi" Jian 12: "Si Fang Shun Zhi." Qin Tao and ancient seal " Shun " is used as the name.

There are also examples of " chuan " and " xun " as " shun " in ancient writing materials. "Guodian Chu Jian. "The Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 5: "The Tao of Dachuan (Shun) is taught to the people." The Jade Inscription of the Warring States Period: "You will live if you patrol (Shun), and die if you go against it."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jin inscription starts with " see " and " chuan " sound. The original meaning is straighten out and obey (Xu Shen).
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「見」，「川」聲，「見」與「頁」形近，小篆字從「頁」，或由「見」演變而來。部分從「川」聲的字有順從之義，如「馴」即鳥獸之順服。因此「順」從「見」，「川」聲，意謂人順服之貌。《說文》：「順，理也。从頁从巛。」小徐本作「巛聲」。中山王鼎、郭店簡與古璽又有從「心」，「川」聲一形。由於順從之「順」與心理活動相關，故從「心」。

　　甲骨文辭殘，「順」字義不詳，《屯南》2080：「于父甲，其順比……」。

　　金文「順」用作本義，指順從，與「逆」相對。中山王鼎：「克順克卑(俾)」，表示擇善而從。《詩．大雅．皇矣》：「王此大邦，克順克比。」毛亨傳：「慈和徧服曰順，擇善而從曰比。」《禮記．樂記》、《史記．樂書》引作「克順克俾」。又中山王方壺：「則𣥺(上)逆於天，下不順於人施(也)。」以「順」與「逆」對舉。另，金文「順」可用為「訓」，𣄰尊：「順(訓)我不每(敏)」，指訓誨我魯鈍不聰敏(唐蘭、馬承源)。傳世古簡中「順」亦可通假作「訓」，《大戴禮記．保傅》：「師導之教順。」《賈子新書．保傅》「順」作「訓」。

　　戰國竹簡「順」用為本義，指順從，《郭店楚簡．緇衣》簡12：「四方順之。」秦陶與古璽中「順」用作人名。

　　古文字材料中又有以「川」、「巡」通假為「順」的例子。《郭店楚簡．唐虞之道》簡5：「教民大川(順)之道也。」戰國行氣玉銘：「巡(順)則生，逆則死。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「見」，「川」聲。本義是理順、順從(許慎)。

順手 [ shùn shǒu ]: easily; without trouble; while one is at it; in passing; handy
順序 [ shùn xù ]: sequence; order

(Simplified: 顺)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 逆
Pictophonetic: 川 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 川 [ chuān ] stream, river
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
①趨向同一個方向，與“逆”相對：順風。順水。順境。順水推舟。順風使舵。
②沿，循：順城街。順理成章。順藤摸瓜。
③依次往後：順序。順次。
④隨，趁便：順便。順勢。順手牽羊。
⑤整理：理順。順修(整理修治)。
⑥服從，不違背：順從。順應。孝順。溫順。
⑦適合，不彆扭：順適。順情。順眼。順差。
⑧姓氏。

順手 [ shùn shǒu ]: easily; without trouble; while one is at it; in passing; handy
順序 [ shùn xù ]: sequence; order

甲骨文從「 見 」，「 川 」聲，「 見 」與「 頁 」形近，小篆字從「 頁 」，或由「 見 」演變而來。部分從「 川 」聲的字有順從之義，如「 馴 」即鳥獸之順服。因此「 順 」從「 見 」，「 川 」聲，意謂人順服之貌。《說文》：「順，理也。从頁从巛。」小徐本作「巛聲」。中山王鼎、郭店簡與古璽又有從「 心 」，「 川 」聲一形。由於順從之「 順 」與心理活動相關，故從「 心 」。 甲骨文辭殘，「 順 」字義不詳，《屯南》2080：「于父甲，其順比……」。 金文「 順 」用作本義，指順從，與「 逆 」相對。中山王鼎：「克順克卑(俾)」，表示擇善而從。《詩．大雅．皇矣》：「王此大邦，克順克比。」毛亨傳：「慈和徧服曰順，擇善而從曰比。」《禮記．樂記》、《史記．樂書》引作「克順克俾」。又中山王方壺：「則𣥺(上)逆於天，下不順於人施(也)。」以「 順 」與「 逆 」對舉。另，金文「 順 」可用為「 訓 」，𣄰尊：「順(訓)我不每(敏)」，指訓誨我魯鈍不聰敏(唐蘭、馬承源)。傳世古簡中「 順 」亦可通假作「 訓 」，《大戴禮記．保傅》：「師導之教順。」《賈子新書．保傅》「 順 」作「 訓 」。 戰國竹簡「 順 」用為本義，指順從，《郭店楚簡．緇衣》簡12：「四方順之。」秦陶與古璽中「 順 」用作人名。 古文字材料中又有以「 川 」、「 巡 」通假為「 順 」的例子。《郭店楚簡．唐虞之道》簡5：「教民大川(順)之道也。」戰國行氣玉銘：「巡(順)則生，逆則死。」

Zhongshan Wangding, Guodian Bamboo Slips and Ancient Seals have the same " heart" and " chuan" sound. Since the " success" of obedience is related to mental activity, it is from the " heart". shùn
вм. 顺
Radicals: 川, 頁  (river, geoduck)
Meaning Mnemonic
For a geoduck to make it into a river, it must know the sequence and order of water flow. Geoducks usually live in the ocean, not in a river, so they must study the order of water flow in order to determine the best sequence for making it into a river.
Imagine this geoduck mapping out a plan to get to the river. It’s studying the sequence and order of water flow. See it sitting there, reading a book, reading glasses and all. It’s quite odd.
Reading Mnemonic
After extensive study of the sequence and order of water, the geoduck has determined that June (じゅん) is the best time to travel to the river. June is the best time for the temperature and atmospheric pressure to be just right for such a journey. In June, the geoduck will set out.
June has arrived. Imagine the geoduck making its way from the ocean to the river. Use whatever makes you think of June to link that month to this scene of the geoduck making his way to the river.

ハ, 川 (река), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина), 頁 (страница)
